result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Adam J. Sutton was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Petition for Exemption of IID is denied- No operable vehicles at residence w/o II

The Petition is GRANTED and the Court orders that the requested vehicles be exempt from ignition interlock requirements. Clerk to prepare form MV3617 and forward a copy to the Department of Transportation.

Case called at 8:35am [mo]
[Hearing on Restitution]
Defendant Adam J. Sutton in court with Attorney Stephen Jay Eisenberg.  ADA Theresa A Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.

ADA Beck indicates that the State is not asking the Court to award the Insurance Company with restitution as it was not charged as a victim type crime; gives further reasoning/basis
---ADA Beck submits fax from EMC Insurance company (insurance company of Fort Atkinson PD)

The Court and Counsel review victim statute, and the definition of a victim therein (950.02)
The Court and Counsel also review restitution statute (973.20)

The Court agrees with the reasoning of the State and the Defense that the Insurance Company is NOT a victim of this crime
The Court sets restitution at $0
recess: 8:45am

[[Prior to hearing Atty. Eisenberg submits a Financial Statement of Debtor on behalf of Mr. Sutton]]
Transcript of Plea and Sentencing Hearing held on 1/14/16 before Judge Koschnick
In response to Clerk's note regarding money amount not matching : Court orders the $50 Safe Ride Surcharge be removed.
Clerk's Note regarding fine plus costs difference

records.addlTxt:
Cases 15CF163 and 15TR4142 called together at 2:30pm [mo]
Defendant Adam J. Sutton in court with attorney Stephen Jay Eisenberg.  ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " Guilty " entered on Count #1 of Case 15CF163; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #2 and #3 of Case 15CF163 and Case 15TR4142

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
--Victim Impact Statement/Restitution Request submitted by ADA Hall

Upon request of Atty. Eisenberg, the Court schedules a Restitution Hearing.

On Count #1 of Case 15CF163 the Court IMPOSES 3 years in the Wisconsin State Prison, consisting of 18 months of Initial Confinement and 18 months of Extended Supervision, to be served consecutive to any sentence in being. Shall this sentence be imposed Defendant is eligible for ERP and SAP

The Court STAYS this sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for a period of 2 years with the following conditions:

 --To serve   120 days   in the Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/work release privileges; to commence FORTHWITH, followed immediately by 120  days on SCRAM X ("good time" credit to be applied to both components of order)
**The Defendant is ordered to report and serve the sentence and/or sentence for failure to pay with absolute sobriety and without illegal drugs in his system; failure to comply will result in loss of Huber/work release without further process. 

--Comply with ALL conditions of Jefferson County Alcohol Treatment Court
--absolute sobriety
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
--take all prescriptions as prescribed
--no presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid Driver's License and Agent Approval
--any assessment, treatment or counseling as required by the Agent
--To pay fine of $750 + costs= $1958.00
--blood testing costs in the amount of 59.06

The Court orders outright: 
--Revocation of drivers license for 24 months
--AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
--Victim impact panel attendance
--Ignition Interlock Device required on any vehicle driven by the Defendant for a 24 month period  
--6 demerit points assessed

Days Credit: 1 day
recess:2:57pm

NEXT: Restitution Hearing on 3/10/16 at 8:30am(allow 1 hour)

Cases 15CF163 and 15TR4142 called together at 1:34pm [mo]
[Continued Motion to Suppress Hearing]
Defendant Adam J. Sutton in court with Attorney Stephen Jay Eisenberg.   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant, Adam Sutton--sworn and testifies
--Direct Examination by Atty. Eisenberg
--Cross Examination by ADA Beck
--Re-Direct Examination by Atty. Eisenberg

Officer, Jeff Hottman--sworn and testifies
--Direct Examination by ADA Beck
--Cross Examination by Atty. Eisenberg
--Questioning by the Court

Evidence Closed at 1:50pm

Arguments re: reasonable suspicion given by ADA Beck
--Questioning by the Court 
Arguments re: reasonable suspicion given by Atty. Eisenberg

As it relates solely to the reasonable suspicion to the Disorderly Conduct with a motor vehicle, the Court finds that the Officer did NOT have reasonable suspicion to stop; gives basis.

Additional Arguments given by Counsel
--Questioning by the Court

The Court accepts the Officer's Testimony, gives basis.

The Court finds that the Officer did have Probable Cause the vehicle, due to 2 previous violations: (1) Operating within a Bike Lane (346.94(12)) and (2)Failure to Operate within a Single Lane. 
The Defendant's Motion to Suppress in Denied.
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling; Atty. Eisenberg requests a Plea/Sentencing hearing in January
Atty. Eisenberg requests that Mr. Sutton's bond be modified to remove the SCRAM monitoring; the Court denies this request. 
The Court reminds Mr. Sutton that his bond and its conditions remains in effect.
The Court notifies that Mr. Sutton's commencement date to jail will be forthwith at the sentencing. 
recess: 2:40pm

NEXT: Plea/Sentencing on 1/14/16 at 2:30pm

Reserve Judge Mawdsley presiding for Branch IV: 
[MK] cases #15CF163 and #15TR4142 called at 1:41pm. 
Defendant Adam J. Sutton in court with Attorney Stephen J Eisenberg.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
As to Case #15CF163: 
----Service of Information admitted; reading is waived; the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
----The Defense stands mute.  Pleas of "not guilty" are entered on the Defendant's behalf.

The Court grants Attorney Eisenberg's request for thirty days to file motions.  Attorney Eisenber is awaiting the squadcar video from FAPD; he intends to file a motion thereafter.
The Court requires Attorney Eisenberg to file motions by 10/26/15.
The Court continues the bond.
recess 1:47pm 

NEXT:  schedule both cases for Motion Hearings (on forthcoming Defense motions) on 11/24/15 at 10:00am--allow two hours
Court approves adjournment, but only for 30 days, not 60 days.

--submits Defense's exh. #4(detailed maps of area of police interaction)offered and received

Case called at 1:55 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Adam J. Sutton appears in custody, via video, from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek. Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Svehlek informs the Court that Mr. Davis is not eligible for SPD services and that she did provide him with the petition for Court appointed counsel
Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient

Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived upon agreement of parties 

Court requires a $2500 signature bond, with conditions:
-No possession or consumption of alcohol 
-No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid license
-No presence in bars, taverns or package houses
-The Defendant is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS, with the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative only when WCS verifies that a defendant's work environment or health condition prohibits the SCRAM bracelet. The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees.  **If in custody, release on SCRAM only - to be done today.**
Recess: 2:00 pm

NEXT: (1) DA Pre-trial Conference scheduled for 6/24/15 at 11:20 am - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for at 7/28/15 at 9:00 am - Send notices
